title: Lexy
text: A virtual assistant/chatbot to streamline HR and LMS processes by integrating multiple platforms in one place.
responsibilities: Designing the architecture of the system
Designing the authentication flow of the system
Integrating bot with Slack, MS Teams, Chrome Extension and Direct Line API
Implementing Dialogs for conversation flow
Implementing NLP using LUIS AI service
Integrating with SumTotal ® Web Services to stream line data into social collaboration platforms
Implementing FAQ's without LUIS AI but string matching algorithm

title: Chasma Editor ™
text: A template editor where you can drag 'n' drop and customize widgets to create dashboards for your SumTotal LMS ®
responsibilities: Designed the architecture of the system
Integrated with SumTotal ® Web Services to get data into dashboards
Implemented drag 'n' drop using gridstack.js
Developed static & dynamic widgets
Developed UI of widgets that bind to static or data from SumTotal LMS ®
Implemented backend code for manipulation of view, layout features and publishing templates

title: Quoting Tool
text: A web application that is used to create quotations for the products requested by a customer and to completely manage the workflow of the quotation from its initial stage to the final stage where it becomes a contract approved by the customer.
responsibilities: Developed the enterprise web application that manages the life cycle of a quotation
Developed end-to-end modules covering the aspects of front-end, back-end and database development.
Analysing the change requests and their impact and providing suggestions
Implemented change requests in phase 2 of the application
Improved the performance of the application
Provided support for UAT and resolved bugs in the application

title: Togetherly
text: A hybrid mobile application that helps couples to have a strong relationship with each other by using love quests, love quotes, chatting, dinning and a dashboard showing their overall status and love percentage and much more.
responsibilities: Developed the RESTful services for the hybrid mobile application using ASP.NET Web API 2
Worked on the change requests and bugs of the application

title: Rebinner
text: A tool used to change the locator of a device, by scanning a locator first and then scanning the serial number which performs the rebin for that device to that locator.
responsibilities: Technical guide on Microsoft.NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Web API and AngularJS

title: TalentX
text: A HR solution designed to overcome the day to day challenges through SASS model it features automated resume parsing, on boarding, off boarding, leave and time management, finance, employee collaboration, community and administration.
responsibilities: Learnt AngularJS
Learnt unit and integration testing
AngularJS developer
Code reviewer
Technical lead
Designing the project solution, different layers and architecting the interaction b/w the layers
Integrated DevExpress controls for Dashboards and Reporting
Developed different aspects of the application - client-side code, server-side code, EF database first approach and data modelling

title: ICampuslite
text: A social collaborative platform for campuses with a complete suite of collection, learning and workflow management tools
responsibilities: Learnt the reporting toolset from DevExpress
Developed the Reporting module which includes the design and development of each report

title: SharePoint Portal Customization
text: The intranet portal of Curvature where they maintain their department information, documents, development tasks, team tasks, their products wiki library in the form of team, wiki and project sites.
responsibilities: Underwent SharePoint training for a month to perform the customizations for the portal and to provide administration support
Implemented a few customizations through WebParts and SharePoint Solution

title: TWS2 Port Tester
text: An application which is used to test the ports of an electronic device in parallel to verify which ports are not working in order to assess the quotation for the device while reselling it.
responsibilities: Sole developer of the WPF application
Designing the GUI of the application
Writing XAML, C#, ADO.NET code following the MVVM pattern
Multi-threading using Task Parallel Library to test maximum of 192 ports in parallel
Dynamic layout changes based on port and plug count which represents the real device plugs and ports
Implemented stress test mode with good memory, CPU usage where the app pings the ports indefinitely until the user stops the execution
Talk to SQL Server and Oracle databases
Implementing responsive and rich GUI using Modern UI for WPF, fast and fluid performance using Task Parallel Library

title: TWS2 General Application
text: An enterprise version of the TWS2 Script Editor which is used to test the hardware components in order to generate quotation for reselling it
responsibilities: Learnt WPF, TPL and using MVVM pattern
Designing the GUI of the application
Evaluated different 3rd party WPF controls and choose to integrate DevExpress WPF controls
Customizing DevExpress WPF control themes
Writing XAML, C#, ADO.NET code following the MVVM pattern

Improved the performance of the application using Task Parallel Library to a great extent to execute 1, 00, 000 lines of code coming from a python script generated by using a loop in less than 10 seconds and displaying the output in real time on a standard WPF TextBox control which took 460MB of RAM
Running tests in parallel and writing to the corresponding test station’s output panel and supporting up to 96 test stations
Fixed the challenge of mapping the output coming from the port to its corresponding test station in the application by working with a team mate which took about 5 days

title: TWS2 Script Editor
text: TWS2 Script Editor is a prototype application that executes python scripts that interact with the hardware in order to test their functioning which helps to generate quotation for the hardware to resell it
responsibilities: Learnt WPF, TPL and MVVM pattern in less time
Desiged the GUI of the application using Modern UI
Developed the application by writing XAML and C# code
Wrote multi-threaded code using Task Parallel Library
Performed state management, data validation, database interactions with SQL Server and Oracle through ADO.NET

title: Data Feed for Yamaha ®
text: Simple data feed applications that reads input and generates the output to be processed by a SumTotal LMS data synchronization tool by interacting with SumTotal Web Services and SumTotal database.
responsibilities: Developed the WinForms application that processes an excel sheet and outputs a text file to be processed by SumTotal data sync tool by interacting with SQL Server 2008 R2 to update SumTotal LMS data

title: Pixentia ™ website
text: The company website of Pixentia ™ which presents information about its services, products, blogs, news and case studies.
responsibilities: Learn the building blocks of an ASP.NET MVC 4 application in a week from http://www.asp.net
Developing the client-side, server-side and database of the application

title: Yamaha ® Web Services Upgrade
text: The upgrade of Yamaha’s training portal based on SumTotal LMS.
responsibilities: Lead the upgrade of ASP.NET Web Services from Microsoft.NET framework 2.0 to 3.5 and SQL Server from 2005 to 2008 R2 with a team mate who performed the SumTotal installations and configured setting of the LMS
Performed minor changes and add-ons and fixed the breaking changes by using fiddler
Used Telerik JustDecompile, JetBrains dotPeek to extract the project as we were only given the DLL’s

title: ASI ® Job Feed
text: A job feed to update employee’s training data in Yamaha LMS portal based on SumTotal LMS
responsibilities: Using 3rd party ASP.NET Web Services to update employees data in the SumTotal LMS through a Console Application running in Task Scheduler

title: CUNA ® Data Feed
text: A job feed to update employee’s training data in CUNA ® LMS portal based on SumTotal ® LMS
responsibilities: Understanding SumTotal Web Services SDK and SumTotal Data Dictionary in less time
Lead the development of the Console Application which involved using SumTotal Web Services
